data.description: Our CompanyChanging the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity This internship will be jointly hosted by the Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) AI and Engineering Team and Adobe Research. Together, these groups are developing the next generation of advanced technologies and user experiences, enabling new forms of creativity, freeing people from routine tasks, and helping enterprises act quickly on customer and business insights. Our teams publish in leading journals and conferences, collaborate with product groups on highimpact features, and explore innovative product opportunities across multiple domains.  This internship will focus specifically on Agentic research in Enterprise applications, with the goal of advancing intelligent, adaptive systems that can assist organizations at scale, while also emphasizing the importance of reliability to ensure consistent and dependable performance in enterprise environments. Core Research Areas Include: AI & Machine Learning Data Intelligence Systems and Languages Natural Language Processing HumanComputer Interaction Intelligent Agents & Assistants What You Will Do Under the guidance of a mentors from AI and Research teams, you will: Pursue a research problem relevant to Adobe’s products, with opportunities for academic publication Develop new algorithms, conduct experiments, and build demonstration prototypes Document and present your work effectively, both in writing and verbally Generate code artifacts and publishable quality papers relevant to Adobe’s products What You Will Need Enrollment in a PhD or master’s program in computer science or a related field (exceptional undergraduates may also be considered) Strong research skills and relevant background in your chosen area Excellent communication and teamwork abilities Passion for solving realworld problems with webscale data using innovative Machine Learning and Agentic AI techniques Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $45.00 -- $61.00 hourly. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay rate for your job location during the hiring process.State-Specific Notices:California:Fair Chance OrdinancesAdobe will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and “fair chance” ordinances.Colorado:Application Window NoticeJan 29 2026 12:00 AMIf this role is open to hiring in Colorado (as listed on the job posting), the application window will remain open until at least the date and time stated above in Pacific Time, in compliance with Colorado pay transparency regulations. If this role does not have Colorado listed as a hiring location, no specific application window applies, and the posting may close at any time based on hiring needs.Massachusetts:Massachusetts Legal NoticeIt is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment.
